column4: E: Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/), are you root?
that's what I'm going to try now.
I need to install dchroot but I got this message from the terminal:  E: Couldn't find package dchroot
I'm not 100% sure, but that was the last thing I did on the computer .
Are you asking me to reinstall my OS?
because I don't want to do that if I don't have to.
I think it did.  I'm not 100% sure.  I'm hoping that that's the cause.
so that what we are doing will fix the problem
: have you tried the vesa driver in xorg
the recovery mode might just enable the vesa driver by default
: it will give you an option to do a recovery boot.
you could swap the video driver while in text mode
at least you would have a booted system,... more than you had before
: you could potentially use tools like apt or aptitude to do it for you
I had to reinstall because my /boot partiton died..  I couldn't even boot as far as getting to "Grub"
